summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Department of Justice officials discussing an incoming request from French authorities regarding the Epstein case. It mentions that the Paris prosecutor's office is preparing a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request and forwards a citizen correspondence for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Forwards correspondence related to Epstein to the FBI as per policy.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding French Inquiry
events.description: DOJ officials discuss an incoming MLAT request from the Paris prosecutor's office and forward citizen correspondence related to Epstein.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: French Judicial Police are involved in the Epstein investigation, indicating international cooperation.
The Paris prosecutor's office is preparing a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to the U.S.
A citizen correspondence related to Epstein was forwarded to the FBI for review.
The email chain shows coordination between U.S. and French authorities in late 2019.
